item.title: Adilla add a quote by virginia woolf
item.description: "As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world." -- virginia woolf

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Adilla add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "I am tomorrow, or some future day, what I establish today. I am today what I established yesterday or some previous day." -- James Joyce

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Although a skillful flatterer is a most delightful companion if you have him all to yourself, his taste becomes very doubtful when he takes to complimenting other people." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Hercule Poirot: I am an imbecile. I see only half of the picture. Miss Lemon: I don't even see that." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation." "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Adilla add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery." -- James Joyce

item.title: Adilla add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake." -- James Joyce

item.title: Adilla add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Adilla add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Adilla add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description:
"My religious convictions and scientific views cannot at present be more specifically defined than as those of a believer in creative evolution. I desire that no public monument or work of art or inscription or sermon or ritual service commemorating me shall suggest that I accepted the tenets peculiar to any established church or denomination nor take the form of a cross or any other instrument of torture or symbol of blood sacrifice.
[<i>From the will of GBS</i>]" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Adilla add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adilla add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde
